reviews.review_msg: one of the best crim classes i have taken and Sheri is an amazing Prof!!!!!

Not as tough as I expected. Two exams (25% each) verbatim from the study questions. Two 750 word papers (10% each), two 1-hour BBC discussions (10% each), and a short research assignment (10%). As long as you read the textbook and do all the study questions, you will be fine. You get to create your own topic for the two short papers.

This is by far one of my favorite classes that I have taken at SFU. However, you do need to keep up with the readings in order to do well. Instructions are clear and concepts are straightforward. MT/Final consisted of short answers and were fair. TA Kouri was very helpful and provided great feedback. Highly recommended!

The class average for the midterm is very poor, and apparently that is common. She does not offer a "no double jeopardy" rule, so you can be penalized for answering one question wrong on all subsequent questions that rely on it. The material is not that bad but the test format is terrible.

Joan knows her stuff- make sure to read the text and know the case studies (significance of ruling/criteria). She is very clear about what is going to be on the midterm. If you have questions see her in office hours or email- the TA was useless. Very interesting class if you like learning about law.

This class is hard!! Must memorize entire textbook in order to do well. TA was absolutely useless but Joan is helpful so make sure you go talk to her if you don't understand.Even though the exam was brutal, the assignments are easy and she marked the court observation fairly.

Do not underestimate how hard this class will be & how much studying this will take!! Exams are so hard but she is incredibly helpful. Class has gone to crap since Kory isn't the TA anymore, and good TA is essential for doing well.  32 Fs & 16 Ds in this class, I'm pretty sure it was b/c it's the first sem w/o Kory as TA
Helpful because she remarked a test where the TA messed up. Still, 33 people failed the mid term and did not curve. Needs to hire a better TA.
SUCKS. Terrible at lectures. Unorganized, and overall just poor.

I took this class via distance and found the class to be very interesting, and learned quite a lot. The courtroom observation was an amazing experience. Reading the different cases and using the criminal code in interpreting the cases was very interesting. If you study the textbook well you should be able to do well in this class.
Had her for both Crim 330 and 432. I don't understand why a lot of people find her hard. If you keep up with what you are required and work hard, you can get a lot out of her classes.
It takes a lot of hard work to do well in this class, but it is possible if you keep up on the work and readings. Joan is a great prof, very knowledgeable. I thoroughly enjoyed this class!

Wow this class is torture.. it sucks it's a required class and Brockman makes it even worse. Only take this course if you need it and I wouldn't recommend her as a prof as her lectures are incomprehensible at best.

JIncredibly intelligent and she actually wants to be a teacher so that's great, she also is straight forward. if you're used to messing around with late submissions or falling behind for no reason, you'll find it harder than it is.  She isn't nice or approachable. know everything in the text and you'll do fine, easy midterm no surprises

Took this course by Dis. Ed and the experience was great. TA Kouri was very helpful at all times. The courtroom observation takes effort but it was fun. The commentaries and legal research assignments are easy marks to grab. The exams however are difficult. Lots of details are required in doing well in them. A good required course.

Took this course by distance. Had Kouri for a TA who is great!!! very helpful. This course is not as hard as people thing. Just be sure to read the textbook take good notes and re-right you notes lots before the midterm because this is really the only way to do well. I really enjoyed this course!

I took this class by distance ed. One of the harder courses I've taken at SFU. Midterms and finals are short answer, but lots of details are expected. Class average for exams is very low. The courtroom observation and the legal research assignment are easy and will up your grade. TA Kouri was very helpful and a fair marker.

One of the few profs who treat students as adults - unforgiving if you skip classes/fail to hand in stuff on time. I appreciate not being treated like babies and require hand-holding throughout my studies. Brockman is a fair marker, and an excellent lecturer. She's a tough one, but she's a great prof.

Read RMP. Take class. Fail...right? No, only if your just stupid. I paid attention, did everything that I was supposed to and studied. Got an A+. Of course it was hard, but come on seriously? She outlines the course briefly so you really have to understand the material. Ben was an amazing TA, too bad he's a master now. Read, understand, study =easy

Hard class in that you have to memorize alot!!! dont' skip lectures, every lecture counts. Midterm and final are all written! consists of 15 and 10 mark questions! no MC.. study hard, you get the mark! not a GPA Booster!! So be cautious and aware! Have to attend tutorials and participate like crazy to get good tutorial participation marks..

OH. MY. GOD. That's all I can say. Probably the most brutal class I have ever taken in my entire undergraduate career. The midterm was EXTRA DIFFICULT. The class average for that was almost a fail and she said that is NORMAL! I will never take another course with her again if I can help it and I advise everyone else to stay away from her. Horrible!

Was losing my interest in Crim until I took this course.  Got creamed on the midterm C- but it forced me to rethink my goals as a student and helped me get back on track.  Finished off with an A-!  Good challenging course.  Good for would be lawyers as this is the stuff you will be looking at.

I entered this course expecting the worst (primarily based on all the Brockman haters on this website).  Yes, the course is difficult.  Yes, you have to put a lot of effort in to the A you want.  A little bit of healthy fear went a long way for me.  Brockman seems intimidating, but is quite helpful if you have an intelligent question.  Good Luck.

TORTURE!!! This class was pathetic and coma inducing!! I hate the fact it's required. You go through so much theory up to this point then this crappy criminal code memorizing class. Hate the class, hated the prof. TOTALLY lowered my high GPA

Joan is an extremely picky marker, and very demanding on what she expects.  She is fair, but very demanding.  I think taking classes with her you will do way more work than someone else teaching the same class.  You may learn more, but I'm not the kind of person who likes being drove into the ground.  This class lowered my GPA =(
Aviod taking her if you can for Crim 330,

Midterm was brutal - I knew everything but she marks extremely strictly. Court Observation was great, she marks that easy. Study the textbook a LOT. Bad at answering questions, not a great teacher overall. If you can take this class with David Macalister instead, do it.

I love Brockman! She's a wonderful professor! Her lectures are informative, organized, and interesting. Her book is excellent, relevant and very clear. And she is extremely helpful if you ask her for clarification.  I like her humour too, though it may be a little too subtle for most crim students. One of my fave profs up here.

I found Joan confusing at first, but I think that's just the nature of the course material. She speaks rapidly, but she's knowledgeable, open to questions, and keeps hand-outs at her office for classes you missed! Exams concentrate on the textbook, and assignments are marked pretty leniently.
No Comments

She's quite an intelligent woman. Goes pretty quickly through her lecture, but if you do your readings (especially ahead of time), it's completely manageable. The midterm is marked pretty hard, but paper and final are fine.

What? Joan is one of the best crim profs! She's not fast- someone may think that if they failed to read the chapter beforehand. This isn't a high-school class. She's funny, smart and articulate. Helpful too if you ask her questions. I would most definately take another class with her.
Talks to fast and she makes it boring too. Although the TA made it all work out.

She talks really fast. I didn't really understand her lectures; I rather read the text. The paper was fun because it was based on courtroom observations & she was an easy marker on the paper. The midterm was difficult but the final exam was easier, probably cuz I knew what to expect going into it. Be prepared to study a lot!

This class has the potential to be the most interesting class offered in CRIM; however, Joan's teaching style does not fit with this type of class. She lectures fast with no real overheads, and she is not very helpful.Class average for the difficult mid term was around 60% because of a trick question that was included. Joan:6.5/10

personally I dont think that she is a very good teacher at all, she says no fact pattern on the midterm, and then what was the entire midterm a fact pattern.. not interesting, not exciting I wouldnt recommend her.
I got an A+ in her class and I feel really guilty.  I really feel that I deserved a B+ or something. I did do all the work and studied a lot, but do I really deserve an A+?

Joan wrote the text, so if she condradicts herself then dont you think the book will too?? I thought she was very knowledgable. Midterm is ok, don't screw up the fact pattern question. Get to the courtroom obs early cause sometimes it takes awhile to find a case. Interesting material.
She is nice but she doesn't know what she is talking about.  She contradicts herself often.  Ignore her and study the textbook.
makes you work but v, v, fair and you learn alot. great prof
No Comments

The tests in this class are insane. You get a cheat sheet but it doesn't even help. Macalister is a very knowledgeable and respected prof but the content of this class is extremely hard and much harder when you take it with him. Even studying like crazy doesn't guarantee a decent grade. I recommend taking the course with Brockman or Bowbrick.

David is a brilliant professor who knows his material inside out; however, he is not the best lecturer as his lectures are quite boring and unclear. Lecture slides will not help much so get ready to read!!
Although interesting, he sucks at keeping on track with course outline.  Exams require a lot of work, but you  are allowed to have a cheat sheet.
difficult exam material. TA's don't help you out much, your basically on your own. Requires a lot of reading. On the bright side, not cumulative!

The class is very interesting. He knows what he's talking about but at times he can be very unorganized!!! which in annoying for a class that requires you to know so much. The TA (Anita) was nice but she's laughed at us when we got our midterm mark back and told us how bad we did...Also, she was never prepared for tutorial and a hard marker!

Exams are pretty difficult, but he knows his material inside out and he is one of the nicest and most helpful profs in the dept. Lecture slides are really good because they summarize the cases and pretty much tell you what you need to know. I'm really glad I got to take classes with him and would recommend him for any class.
David knows his material inside and out. Tries to make dry material interesting by cracking jokes here and there. He's an excellent lecturer. Very organized, and clear in his lectures.
Really great professor - absolutely brilliant. Great legal scholar. Interesting classes and material. Keeps students engaged and genuinely wants them do well.

Entertaining lectures that prepare you well for exams.Tons of material to cover in this class with a midterm/final that are both pretty tight on time. The TA (Kouri) is helpful and runs an awesome tutorial. Just make sure to complete all the readings and the class in manageable.

Lecture slides and recordings posted online, so attendance is not mandatory. Very clear on what is expected on exams, additional assignments were fair and straightforward. Allowed the use of cheatsheets, which if done properly, help tremendously. TA Kouri was awesome!

NOT an easy class!! very knowledgeable prof but has very high expectations! class avg is 66%. DO NOT slack off and do the readings. its a lot of work for this class but david is such a good prof, he's worth having as a prof! wish he would cut down on the required readings but o well. the presentation, participation & assignment will boost your mark

midterm is tough. multiple choice is tricky. on the plus side there are many opportunities for you to boost your mark such as the legal research, presentation and participation. extremely knowledgeable prof, he seems to know the law inside out. we are quite lucky to have an instructor like him at sfu. overall, recommended.

Midterm and final were very tight on time, but heavily reliant on familiarity (not memorization). and I'm usually out halfway through. Spectacular notes, great TA (Kouri). Just review notes and Code and you'll do well.

Very nice and approachable prof. The course material, somewhat, is intense but he tried to make the examples as clear as possible. He is a patient person and tried to make people happy with their mark.

loves to use case law, so understand the precedent of the case, not the little facts of the case. His test are fair, but midterm was tight on time. His notes are really good, almost to good that i didn't even read the book for the final. assignments are pretty straight forward. But all in all, its like a criminal law class, learn a case and apply

David inputs humour whenever he can into lectures. He tries his best to keep students engaged and gives good examples. Exams are fair if you have a well written cheat sheet. David is a good lecturer and the exams are fair. Bonus, there are NO PAPERS for this class!!!

I had MacAlister for crim 330. Good class..yes he does use humour quite a bit and some of it can get a little offensive but it keeps you awake. Very hard midterm and final (I am a B+ and higher student and found this class hard). Make sure that you attend lecture+tutorials+know the cases for this class.
knowlegeable, interesting, helpful....keeps it light and informative and makes you think...excellent
Terrible professor. I will never take another class he teaches. Received a great grade, but only through getting clarification from others. Very unhelpful.

I am not happy. I was looking forward to this course but I do not feel like I am getting my money's worth. Prof. McAlister makes too many jokes about serious current events and he does not have ready answers to many issues. I should have waited for another Prof.
He rocks!  super TA also...makes a fairly drab subject interesting and palatable.
power point ... need to know lots of material
